item.description:
Last minute decision for Franconia Ridge. Weather is calling to be clear winds 10 miles per hour. A perfect time to do this hike bearing in mind that weather conditions can change suddenly. Full winter gear including snowshoes, crampons, goggles,and face mask No cotton clothing of any sorts allowed! Layering a must!!
This is going to be advance hike prior winter hiking a must! You will only be able to sign up on the waiting list also will have to e-mail one of the organizers so we can exchange phone numbers unless of course we know you and you hiking abilities..

We will meet at Lafayette parking lot for seven am. We will follow Falling Waters Trail to Little Haystack Mtn we will then follow the ridge to Mt Lincoln and then continue to Mt Lafayette from there we will decend on Greenleaf trail to Old Bridel Path trail which will bring us back to where we started. This is going to be a nine mile hike.

Be prepared to hike with this group as a group our motto is: We go in as a group and we come out as a group. We will hike at a pace of our slowest hiker.

We all have our own individual pace and many organizers offer many levels of hiking to give you options of the level and pace that is comfortable for you. Mountain weather is subject to rapid changes and extreme conditions. We will assess travel and weather conditions during our hike and make changes to our planned trip as necessary.

Being prepared, traveling with the appropriate gear & knowing how to use it is your personal responsibility. Test and adjust your gear prior to this trip.

!! NO COTTON CLOTHING !! - Cotton (a.k.a. the death cloth) has no place in the mountains. If you arrive wearing cotton clothing you will be turned away.



--------------------------------------------------------------------------------


As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.
item.name: Franconia Ridge
